definition: to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study

sentences.english: Begging is to request a donation in a supplicating manner.
sentences.chinese: 乞讨是以请求的方试去要求给予捐赠。

sentences.english: You will see Gypsies begging beside the road, but do not give them any money.
sentences.chinese: 你会看到吉普赛人在路边乞讨，但是不要给他们钱。

sentences.english: People who go begging for money or food are called beggars .
sentences.chinese: 那些乞讨钱或食物的人称作为乞丐。

sentences.english: The old women and children were begging in the streets.
sentences.chinese: 老妇和孩子们沿街乞讨。

sentences.english: One can no longer walk the streets without seeing beggars importuning passers by.
sentences.chinese: 走在街上总能看到乞丐纠缠行人乞讨。

sentences.english: New Year's Eve, an old man came into the village.
sentences.chinese: 一年除夕，一位老人来到村里乞讨食物。

sentences.english: He has been a waif for many years.
sentences.chinese: 街上有一个流浪儿正在乞讨。

sentences.english: They were reduced to begging along the street in the end.
sentences.chinese: 最后他们沦落到沿街乞讨。

sentences.english: Poverty reduced them to begging for a living.
sentences.chinese: 贫困迫使他们乞讨为生。

sentences.english: He begged from door to door.
On one lunar New Year's Eve, an old man came into the village.
sentences.chinese: 一年除夕，一位老人来到村里乞讨食物。

sentences.english: He looks around and finds that there is a beggar with shabbily dresses.
sentences.chinese: 他向四周看了看，发现个衣衫褴褛的乞讨者。

sentences.english: Such as sword dressed as a beggar begging, found no suspicious of the people around you.
sentences.chinese: 兰如剑扮成乞丐沿街乞讨，周围没有发现可疑之人。

sentences.english: I never thought he would come down to begging.
sentences.chinese: 我怎么也想不到他会沦落到乞讨为生。

sentences.english: The wonderful gerben in the street begging, but beggars head drive.
sentences.chinese: 妙戈在街上弹琴乞讨，却被乞丐头头驱赶。

sentences.english: The one-legged beggar begins to beg eggs illegally.
sentences.chinese: 这个瘸腿乞丐开始非法乞讨鸡蛋。

definition: to go begging/to ask for alms
to glean/to collect scraps/to eke out a meager living
to give in charity/to give alms (to the poor)
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
beset by hunger and cold (idiom)/starving and freezing/in desperate poverty
to drift about/to wander/to roam/nomadic/homeless/unsettled (e.g. population)/vagrant
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to set up a vendor's stall in the street
